answers.answer: Complications to diabetes occur as the result of uncontolled high blood sugars over a period of time. The goal now is for her to get that blood sugar down quickly with the help of her doctors and then educate herself and begin the long road of learning how to manage diabetes on a day to day basis to avoid complications down the road. There is a lot of information out there. "Using Insulin" by John Walsh is a good book. There are many websites with thousands of diabetics (type 1 and 2) managing their diabetes successfully. Good luck.

question: 21 yr old admitted to hospital with blood sugar of 700.  What complications could she be facing
title: help
